avalancheActivity.comment:
The avalanche danger is moderate above 2400 metres and low below.
The main problem is old snow. In the sectors from west to north to east, slab avalanches can be triggered in some places by even a small additional load. Avalanches can tear through to deeper weak layers and become medium sized if the snow is thick enough.
Small slab avalanches can also be triggered in fresh drift snow, especially in west, north and east exposures above 2200 metres. The few danger spots are located close to the main ridge. Below 2800 m, mainly small sliding snow avalanches can occur spontaneously.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Weak layers in old snow are the main danger

snowpackStructure.comment:
The snow surface is often loose on the shaded side. In the upper part of the snowpack, fresh snow that has blown over close to the ridge can form a weak layer. In the middle part of the snowpack, weak layers of angular crystals have formed between the fresh snow packs of the past week. At high altitudes, angular crystals can also be found at the transition to the compact old snow foundation and occasionally near the ground.
On the sunny side, the snow cover has settled far up and may have hardened in the morning.

tendency.highlights: The problem of old snow remains at altitude.

weatherForecast.comment: On Monday morning, it will snow in the northern Alps with a snow line of around 1000 metres. The clouds will be thick everywhere until midday, then clear up in the afternoon and the sun will shine at times. The wind will be mostly weak, with moderately strong southerly winds in the open high areas of the Tauern. At 2000 metres the temperature will be -4 to -1 degrees Celsius, at 3000 metres around -7 degrees Celsius.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The avalanche danger is low. The main problem is the sliding snow on slopes with exposures from east to south to west. Small sliding snow avalanches can occur spontaneously up to the summits.
Slab avalanches in old snow can only be triggered very rarely on very steep north-facing slopes above 2400 metres.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Avoid terrain under sliding snow cracks

snowpackStructure.comment:
The snow surface is often loose and angular on the shaded side. Edgy, weak layers within the snowpack can only be seen at altitude.
On the sunny side, the snow cover has settled a long way up and may have hardened in the morning.

weatherForecast.comment: On Monday morning, it will snow in the northern Alps with a snow line of around 1000 metres. The clouds will be dense everywhere until midday, clearing in the afternoon with occasional sunshine. The wind will be mostly light. At 2000 metres the temperature will be -4 to -1 degrees Celsius, at 3000 metres around -7 degrees Celsius.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The avalanche danger is low, the main danger is drift snow.
Above 2200 m, small slab avalanches can be triggered in a few places in west, north and east exposures.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Little snow, small drift snow problem

snowpackStructure.comment: The snow surface is wind-treated. In the upper part of the snow cover, overblown fresh snow can form a weak layer. Overall, there is still little snow.

weatherForecast.comment: The clouds will be dense until midday, clearing in the afternoon and the sun will shine at times. The wind will be mostly light. At 2000 metres the temperature will be -4 to -1 degrees Celsius, at 3000 metres around -7 degrees Celsius.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: Be aware of the problem of old snow at high altitudes
